title: Violent Cow Protection in India: Vigilante Groups Attack Minorities ...
htmlTitle: Violent Cow Protection in India: Vigilante Groups Attack Minorities ...
snippet: Feb 18, 2019 ... This report describes the use of communal rhetoric by members of the ... a police officer were killed in mob violence in December 2018 in ...
htmlSnippet: Feb 18, 2019 ... This report describes the use of communal rhetoric by members of the ... a police officer were killed in mob violence in December 2018 in ...

metatags.og:description: This report describes the use of communal rhetoric by members of the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) to spur a violent vigilante campaign against consumption of beef and those engaged in the cattle trade. Between May 2015 and December 2018, at least 44 people – including 36 Muslims – were killed in such attacks. Police often stalled prosecutions of the attackers, while several BJP politicians publicly justified the attacks.
metatags.twitter:image:alt: Members of a cow protection group patrol the streets of Ramgarh, Rajasthan, and confiscate cattle being transported by traders, November 2015.
metatags.og:image:alt: Members of a cow protection group patrol the streets of Ramgarh, Rajasthan, and confiscate cattle being transported by traders, November 2015.
metatags.twitter:title: Violent Cow Protection in India
